The sense doors and their restraint [sn3: When you see a sight with your eyes
When you hear a sound with your ears
When you smell an odor with your nose
When you taste a flavor with your tongue
When you feel a touch with your body
When you know a thought with your mind
The bad unskillful qualities that become: If the faculty of sight were left unrestrained
Bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion would become overwhelming
The practice of restraint (a causal chai: For this reason, practice restraint, protecting the faculty of sight, and achieving its restraint.
For this reason, practice restraint, protecting the faculty of mind, and achieving its restraint.
The behavior of a mendicant (a repetitiv: A mendicant should collect their thoughts as a tortoise draws its limbs into its shell.
Independent, not disturbing others, someone who’s extinguished wouldn’t blame anyone.
